byline.original: By JAY ROOT, ROSS RAMSEY and JIM RUTENBERG
byline.contributor: Sam Bacarisse contributed reporting. Jay Root, Ross Ramsey and Mr. Bacarisse write for The Texas Tribune, which produces a twice-weekly local section in the Texas editions of The New York Times.

abstract: Mike Toomey is a lobbyist, a former legislator and a onetime chief of staff to Texas Gov Rick Perry who has tapped a sprawling network of donors, business allies and friendly or indebted lawmakers to help Perry accomplish ambitious political and legislative goals; should Perry win the Republican nomination for presidency and, later on, the presidency, it will be in no small measure because of the efforts of Toomey.
snippet: In Texas, Mike Toomey is respected and feared for his keen intellect, tough political tactics and relationship with Rick Perry.
lead_paragraph: In Texas, Mike Toomey is respected and feared for his keen intellect, tough political tactics and relationship with Rick Perry.

headline.main: For Perry, Lobbyist Is a Take-No-Prisoners Ally
headline.print_headline: For Perry, Lobbyist Is a Take-No-Prisoners Ally
headline.seo: Mike Toomey, Texas Lobbyist, Is Power Behind Perry
